meanings.definition: The act of splitting open or bursting.
meanings.sent1: The dehiscence of the ripe fruit allowed the seeds to scatter in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The dehiscence of the old tree trunk revealed its hollow interior.
meanings.sent3: The dehiscence of the overstuffed suitcase caused clothes to spill everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The dehiscence of the storm clouds brought forth a downpour of rain.
meanings.sent5: The dehiscence of the balloon filled the room with a loud pop.

meanings.definition: The natural release of seeds from a fruit or pod.
meanings.sent1: The dehiscence of the pea pod scattered its seeds across the garden.
meanings.sent2: The dehiscence of the pine cone allowed the seeds to fall to the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The dehiscence of the popcorn kernel made a mess in the microwave.
meanings.sent4: The dehiscence of the dandelion released its seeds to the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dehiscence of the pomegranate revealed its juicy seeds inside.

meanings.definition: The surgical opening of a wound to promote healing.
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed a dehiscence to clean the wound thoroughly.
meanings.sent2: The dehiscence allowed proper drainage and prevented infection.
meanings.sent3: The dehiscence procedure helped the wound heal faster.
meanings.sent4: The dehiscence revealed the underlying tissues for better treatment.
meanings.sent5: The dehiscence improved the blood flow to the injured area.
